commit_message:
Support to event filtering by level names

We don't have the event filtering implemented properly so far. It
doesn't make sense for users to specify event level values when listing
events. This patch adds a translation utility to do the conversion.

Change-Id: I51bfe6e7d1bf7e7afea7e93720bc78201c78fed8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/49/279049/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import logging EVENT_LEVELS = { 'CRITICAL': logging.CRITICAL, 'ERROR': logging.ERROR, 'WARNING': logging.WARNING, 'INFO': logging.INFO, 'DEBUG': logging.DEBUG, }

commit_message:
Fix db error when running python34 unit tests

If tests for py27 is executed before py34 tests, then there is a chance
that py34 related tests may fail.The following patch fixes it.
Ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:merged++topic:bug/1489059,n,z

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I8a47387790ddbd338c41856ba46ff6eb177d7ff2
Closes-bug: #1489059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/09/264009/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py34,py27,pypy,pep8

commit_message:
UI: table pagination logic encapsulation

* following https://review.openstack.org/#/c/266826/ suggestion: API requests
  that required UI pagination will be passed via generic handler.
* At first I've written a decorator - which I didn't like,
  feel faulty by design - too many returns and over complicated blocks...

Partially implements blueprint: mistral-dashboard-executions-screen

Change-Id: Ie131bf74a74b816d2779888c6c23e7bcfa4b8f22

Allow setting default value for config_drive

This adds a setting that can be used to specify the default value
for the Configuration Drive option when launching an instance.

Closes-Bug: #1537106
Change-Id: If402d3331158b462bece27fa6fce2bdb7f6a4a2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/64/271464/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.conf import settings initial['config_drive'] = getattr(settings, 'CONFIG_DRIVE_DEFAULT_ENABLED', False)

commit_message:
Try to be more verbose on sec group error

Try to identify if the error is due to the security rule
already existing and return the proper message in that case to
not confuse the user.

Change-Id: I13346611b9d7309f84a5bfba8b69ea5e65d0a02a
Closes-Bug: 1298460
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/75/246275/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception as error: if error.message.startswith('Security group rule already exists'): exceptions.handle(request, _('Security group rule already exists.'), redirect=redirect) else: exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to add rule to security group'), redirect=redirect)
deleted_lines: except Exception: exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to add rule to security group.'), redirect=redirect)

commit_message:
Preallocate swapfile

If we need to use a swapfile preallocate it so that we don't get wedged
when both memory and disk have no more space available.

Change-Id: I6517851497a1310f633b5ad9ab5d19e5b2ecce36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/57/278557/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Don't use sparse device to avoid wedging when disk space and # memory are both unavailable. sudo fallocate -l 8192M ${swapfile} sudo chmod 600 ${swapfile} sudo swapon ${swapfile}
deleted_lines: local lodevice=$(sudo losetup -f) sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=${swapfile} bs=1 count=0 seek=8G sudo losetup ${lodevice} ${swapfile} sudo swapon ${lodevice}

commit_message:
Stop using build-dep for numpy/pyyaml depends

The build-dep command requires source repos, which we do not mirror as
nothing else other than this uses them in our gate. However, we can
just list the things these packages need directly instead of relying on
the debian packaging to tell us what we need to build them.

Change-Id: Ib438fec0c706fe2f3af507ef2d75c3456ed726a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/99/279099/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo apt-get install cython gfortran libblas-dev liblapack-dev python-all-dev libyaml-dev
deleted_lines: sudo apt-get build-dep -y --force-yes python-numpy sudo apt-get build-dep -y --force-yes python-yaml

commit_message:
Fix image volume creation error

When "image_upload_use_cinder_backend = True" is specified to
the volume backend and the Glance cinder store is enabled,
upload-to-image command fails with the following error:

  Create clone_image_volume: xxx for image xxx failed
  (Exception: An object of type VolumeAttachmentList is required
   in field volume_attachment, not a )

This is due to unnecessary attributes specified in the volume
params, such as 'volume_attachment' or 'consistencygroup'.
This patch removes the unnecessary attributes from the params.

Change-Id: Ia416cb6686312e1591de7fe40a7ce7d6aa2fce7d
Closes-Bug: #1529762
Related-Bug: #1528087

commit_message:
Sanitize PowerVM partition name

The restrictions on PowerVM partition names are more stringent than
those on nova instance names.  To avoid annoying API errors, if a name
is accepted by nova, we scrub it (using a provided pypowervm interface)
such that it becomes acceptable for PowerVM.

Related-Bug: #1535338

Change-Id: Ic494f4ec05d9f6b1b2c93843ad404c6bee0bfba8

commit_message:
Added CORS support to Aodh

This adds the CORS support middleware to Aodh, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

In previous patches, proper paste support for gabbi was added. This patch
modifies the paste.ini file for both aodh and gabbi, adds the CORS
configuration fixture to support unit tests, and adds CORS into configgen.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact: Add link to CORS configuration in admin cloud guide.

Change-Id: I27673b8581069c9ef02525756d1079b3904d8349

commit_message:
Stop using nose as a Python3 test runner

There are several reasons for this change:
- removes the need for the custome py3 test dependencies
- makes the broken tests more visible because they are listed
  instead of the working ones
- using a blacklist means that new test files are tested by default in
  py3

bp python3

Change-Id: I7472eec05d80cdd99c0ee376159578e0d7306f51

subject: Restore tox.ini hack to pre-depend on pip>=6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 04:06:47.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.privsep/commit/e70b0d862c18d851d1e85f9c79818c13d842414f', 'message': 'Restore tox.ini hack to pre-depend on pip>=6

The ";python_version='2.7'" construct in requirements.txt requires
pip>=6 before it can be parsed correctly.  tox/virtualenv will usually
create the venv with the *system* pip version, which may be too old (eg:
python-pip is 1.5.6-7 in Debian testing at time of writing).

It seems tox/pip/setup.py all lack a clean way to specify dependencies
that will be installed before setup.py is actually invoked, so this
change hacks this in using the tox.ini install_command.

(This reverts this portion of Icf33533348b8b6088abe3d4de5a84f253fe3836d,
which inadvertently(?) removed this line amongst other tox.ini cleanups)

Change-Id: Id291da0b0d660cbfed5f8f683562eebdeb9aaabf
'}]
commit_message:
Restore tox.ini hack to pre-depend on pip>=6

The ";python_version='2.7'" construct in requirements.txt requires
pip>=6 before it can be parsed correctly.  tox/virtualenv will usually
create the venv with the *system* pip version, which may be too old (eg:
python-pip is 1.5.6-7 in Debian testing at time of writing).

It seems tox/pip/setup.py all lack a clean way to specify dependencies
that will be installed before setup.py is actually invoked, so this
change hacks this in using the tox.ini install_command.

(This reverts this portion of Icf33533348b8b6088abe3d4de5a84f253fe3836d,
which inadvertently(?) removed this line amongst other tox.ini cleanups)

Change-Id: Id291da0b0d660cbfed5f8f683562eebdeb9aaabf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.privsep refs/changes/96/278196/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We require pip>=6 before we can even parse requirements.txt correctly. install_command = sh -c 'pip install -U "pip>=6" && pip install -U "$@"' pip {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Limit apt cache invalidation

This fix will update APT caches if they are 24h old and
prevents situation where the APT cache will invalidate during
playbook runs, causing unnecessary delays during execution.
The override apt_cache_expiration_time has been set to 24 hours
and can be altered if necessary.

Change-Id: I4c2ebe4c3a5e6df91acfe23daf837b31d7005213
Closes-Bug: #1544322
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/94/279294/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cache_valid_time: "{{ apt_cache_expiration_time }}"

commit_message:
grab less data when adding measures

get aggregatedtimeserie starting from first timestamp in timeseries
to be added. this should minimise the amount of split timeseries
we need to update, specifically for policies with a lot of points.

Change-Id: Ic8768623bcce1f6340ce2928367199b70b83d6c5

commit_message:
Fixed confirmInput parameter name in Dynamic UI docs

The Version history in dynamic_ui.rst contains confirmPassword parameter
name which doesn't match actual implementation in murano-dashboard.
The correct name is "confirmInput" and this change fixes the docs to
match the code.

Change-Id: Ifa7057657e6fd78457ec00d7bc8fdb15d07835fa

commit_message:
Improve is-public argument in env-template-create

Changed --is-public argument to action='store_true' to avoid user
input additional true/false. This is more straight to user, and
consistent with --is-public argument in other subcommand, like
'package-import'.

Change-Id: I6bc90a81156b800a88a2801556769977b4b8df79
Closes-Bug: #1544449
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/43/278943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.shell('env-template-create --is-public env-name') self.client.env_templates.create.assert_has_calls([ mock.call({'name': 'env-name', 'is_public': False}), mock.call({'name': 'env-name', 'is_public': True}) ])

commit_message:
Support MTU advertisement using IPv6 RAs

RFC4861 allows us to specify the Link MTU using IPv6 RAs.
When advertise_mtu is set in the config, this patch supports
advertising the LinkMTU using Router Advertisements.

Partially Implements: blueprint mtu-selection-and-advertisement
Closes-Bug: #1495444
Change-Id: I50d40cd3b8eabf1899461a80e729d5bd1e727f28

commit_message:
Fix validation of password fields form with confirmInput=false

Application deployment forms which contain "password" type fields with
confirmInput set to false don't show the second input for password
confirmation but during form validation expect both inputs to contain
the same value.

With this change the copy of password is not checked if confirmInput
is set to false.

Change-Id: I2353e2497f9c66dd9d9c0d543792a80bf1ae2a1b
Closes-Bug: #1540867

commit_message:
Make init element configurable for bifrost vagrant VM

Bifrost vagrant uses simple-init by default for post install modifications.
This patch allows the use of an alternate init mechanism, eg: cloud-init

Change-Id: If22416f48fbf43173f008c86b978f11d937a8a99
Co-Authored-By: John.L.Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1541548

commit_message:
Increase default Cinder LVM backing file to 10G

We get false negatives from Tempest when the Cinder LVM backing
file runs out space. This change increases its default size to 10G,
matching devstack [1]

1. https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/stackrc#L649

Change-Id: Ia334ea481e17c1d35aa67c33729cac6570f48199

commit_message:
Periodic Devstack job against oslo.* from master

So this job will checkout all the oslo.* projects from
master and run the full tempest test suite. Neutron has
been switched on as well.

Change-Id: I099474325f3ea8e8d302529690d99b4b89ddd32b

commit_message:
Enable testr run passthrough arguments

This commit enables passing through any unknown arguments to testr run.
There are several features in testr's run cli which aren't exposed in
ostestr. Instead of adding a duplicate argument for each of these this
commit will capture any unidentified arguments and will pass them
through to the testr run subprocess call.

Change-Id: I26eb5c6a5908258c3035b93d72924646bb834d40

Bump the upper constraint for python-manilaclient

commit_message:
Add regex matching for cluster_templates_list()

This change implements regex matching for filters on string
values passed to cluster_templates_list() in the REST api.
No existing internal calls that use cluster_templates_get_all()
are affected.

Partial-bug: #1503345
Change-Id: I1a320ff8c01ef5fdc5e66ed35a2b7a6ec9173175

commit_message:
Update ssh console support specs

In order not to affect the gate logs 'ironic-bm-logs/', leave
log console by default, and add ability to enable pty console
in devstack scripts.

Change-Id: I436eaa75dbcae37d84f13ed27d8ff7052822d77e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/35/276535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Add ability to enable pty console in devstack scripts, and leave the log console by default in order to not affect the gate logs.
deleted_lines: Enable tty console in devstack scripts.

commit_message:
fix pxc grow after shrink was called

Forgot to ignore the deleted instances when looking for details on the
existing clustered instances.

Closes-Bug: #1544708

commit_message:
Enable X-Forwarded-Proto header for keystone admin endpoint

This is useful for handling URLs properly when TLS is enabled.

Change-Id: I4defed679cf3b2980dcc4ce1db030c0fdf154bfe

commit_message:
puppet: run keystone in wsgi

For both HA & non-HA scenarios, switch puppet-keystone configuration to
be run in a WSGI process instead of eventlet.
WSGI is the way to go for scaling Keystone, moreover, eventlet won't be
support in next OpenStack releases.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I22a348c298ff44f616b2e898f4872eddea040239

Change-Id: I862b4a68f43347564ec3c0ddc4ec9e1d1c755cf2
Signed-off-by: Jason Guiditta <jguiditt@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-24 22:46:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/87b0933a2194ed5191bf32a07aad0521e6ee3df5', 'message': 'Support zeromq messaging driver in cinder

ZeroMQ driver requires hostname for message delivery as there is no
broker inbetween.
So, extract the hostname and feed to the messaging client for zeromq
driver.

Change-Id: Ic4b4301e5d7ca1692fc91155ba53f2dd12f99311
Closes-Bug: #1440631
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-25 13:11:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/302862aa2c734c6965bc84d359c8cf501bdf0579', 'message': 'Support ZeroMQ messaging driver in cinder

ZeroMQ driver requires hostname for message delivery as there is no
broker inbetween.
So, extract the hostname and feed to the messaging client for zeromq
driver.

For the record, ZeroMq is a very lightweight distributed messaging system
specially designed for high throughput/low latency scenarios.
Addition of support for ZeroMQ would help cinder scale out with high
performance and be highly available as there is no centralised broker.

Change-Id: Ic4b4301e5d7ca1692fc91155ba53f2dd12f99311
Closes-Bug: #1440631

commit_message:
Support ZeroMQ messaging driver in cinder

NOTE:This patch introduces support for ZeroMQ driver for cinder single
backend case.
Multi-backend will be addressed in the next patch as part of the
blueprint.

CHANGES:ZeroMQ driver requires hostname for message delivery as there is no
broker inbetween.
So, extract the hostname and feed to the messaging client for zeromq
driver.

For the record, ZeroMq is a very lightweight distributed messaging system
specially designed for high throughput/low latency scenarios.
Addition of support for ZeroMQ would help cinder scale out with high
performance and be highly available as there is no centralised broker.

DocImpact
Document the configurations for ZeroMQ driver for Cinder

Change-Id: Ic4b4301e5d7ca1692fc91155ba53f2dd12f99311
Closes-Bug: #1440631
partially Implements bp cinder-zeromq-support

subject: Fix debug and info option parsing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-02 10:56:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/b5356a57887ce7a11b258a2e410b34512e419318', 'message': 'Fix debug and info option parsing

The debug and info options need to be set before a subcommand method is called,
otherwise they are simply ignored. This is kind of irritating - other options
(for example -U, -A, -K) are usable after a positional command.

This patch ads a inherited class for OptionParser, making it possible to parse
args even if they are not yet known. Doing so allows to parse all args before
calling the subcommand method. Invalid arguments are still raising an error,
because any subcommand method will finally parse the args itself and raise an
error eventually.

Change-Id: Ib19b05deef7a015881f1eed4a3946025e16bf922

commit_message:
Fix debug and info option parsing

The debug and info options need to be set before a subcommand method is called,
otherwise they are simply ignored. This is kind of irritating - other options
(for example -U, -A, -K) are usable after a positional command.

This patch fixes this, and commands like these are no longer ignoring --debug or --info:

 swift stat --debug
 swift list container --info

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>

Change-Id: Ib19b05deef7a015881f1eed4a3946025e16bf922

commit_message:
Adding hz-if-neutron-extensions directive

We should add neutron extensions to angular cloud services
in a similar fashion as that of cinder and nova services.

Change-Id: I184f520568a807ae5948e73eed33023787b204d8
Closes-Bug: 1522135

subject: Update translation setup for neutron subprojects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-28 23:33:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2c31ff5ef32264dc0d314f0c6b9bd0c94d478c26', 'message': 'Update translation setup for neutron subprojects

The infra and i18n team is now setting up the new infra setup
for translations. This commit updates the corresponding devref
document on the subproject guidelines.
For more detail, see the infra spec available at
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack-infra/infra-specs/specs/translation_setup.html.

commit_message:
Update translation setup for neutron subprojects

The infra and i18n team is now setting up the new infra setup
for translations. This commit updates the corresponding devref
document on the subproject guidelines.
For more detail, see the infra spec available at
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack-infra/infra-specs/specs/translation_setup.html.

This basically renames $reponame/locale/$reponame.pot to
$modulename/locale/$modulename.pot.

Change-Id: I7e402453a53fc7b13193f65c71aa1764f1c18924
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/20/273820/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **DOMAIN** name should match your **module** name ``${MODULE_NAME}``. output_file = ${MODULE_NAME}/locale/${MODULE_NAME}.pot directory = ${MODULE_NAME}/locale domain = ${MODULE_NAME} domain = ${MODULE_NAME} output_dir = ${MODULE_NAME}/locale input_file = ${MODULE_NAME}/locale/${MODULE_NAME}.pot Note that ``${MODULE_NAME}`` is used in all names.There is no need to create a directory ``locale`` for message catalogs.
deleted_lines: **DOMAIN** name should match your **repository** name ``${REPOSITORY}``. (Note that it is not a top level python path name ``${MODULE_NAME}``.)* skeleton POT file output_file = ${REPOSITORY}/locale/${REPOSITORY}.pot directory = ${REPOSITORY}/locale domain = ${REPOSITORY} domain = ${REPOSITORY} output_dir = ${REPOSITORY}/locale input_file = ${REPOSITORY}/locale/${REPOSITORY}.pot Note that ``${REPOSITORY}`` is used in all names. Both come from the implementation of the current infra scripts. Changing it affects many projects, so it is not a good idea.Finally, create a skeleton POT file. To import translation, we need to place it at the proper place. Run the following commands in the top directory of your repository:: $ mkdir -p ${REPOSITORY}/locale $ tox -e venv -- python setup.py extract_messages Now you see ``${REPOSITORY}/locale/${REPOSITORY}.pot``.

commit_message:
stadium: Add a guideline related to project scope.

This guideline is intended to encourage new "advanced services" projects to
be set up as separate OpenStack project teams.

Change-Id: Ieb2e9efa782f2bcc951139558fbb7eecf3e6a46a
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/25/278025/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * The area of functionality of a sub-project should be taken into consideration. The closer the functionality is to the base functionality implemented in openstack/neutron, the more likely it makes sense under the Neutron project team. Conversely, something "higher" in the stack considered an optional advanced service is more likely to make sense as an independent project.**Q: Why are several "advanced service" projects still included under Neutron?** neutron-lbaas, neutron-fwaas, and neutron-vpnaas are all included under the Neutron project team largely for historical reasons. They were originally a part of neutron itself and are still a part of the neutron deliverable in terms of OpenStack governance. Because of the deliverable inclusion, they should really only be considered for a move on a release boundary.

Pecan: wrap PUT response with resource name

For no peculiar reason other than that's the way the API is
supposed to work.

commit_message:
Skip V-38462 in gate and cap ansible-lint

openstack-infra are creating images containing an apt.d configuration
that sets AllowUnauthenticated to true to support their custom apt
repos which contain unsigned packages.  The presence of this file causes
openstack-ansible-security to fail.  We can either remove the file, or
skip the V-38462 tag.  Skipping the tag in the gate is probably the
better long term solution.

Additionally, ansible-lint 2.3.8 was released today and is now causing
a number of ANSIBLE0008 errors to fail the gate.  This is a temporary
cap to unblock the gate.

Change-Id: I2c78f4e913e99e5fc5d84fba9e28197b73ac8f25
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/89/278789/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ANSIBLE_PARAMETERS=${ANSIBLE_PARAMETERS:-"--skip-tag V-38462"}

commit_message:
Pecan: Controller and test refactor

This patch refactors the pecan controllers and functional tests
by spliting the code in several modules in order to avoid excessive
growth and ensure some level of consistency as regards function
and classes defined in each module.

To this aim:
- The generic resource controllers are moved into their own module
- Other controllers, such as extension and quotas, are moved into
  their own module
- Functional tests are split into 3 modules: one for generic tests,
  one for request processing tests, and the latter for testing hooks.

Related blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch

Change-Id: Id76cd88208dfd273bccadc15a1c6febbcc4fc030

commit_message:
Expose X-Trace-* constants

For users that want to know what the currently used
trace headers are in a progamatic way it is nice to
expose these headers as constants that others can
easily import.

This makes it possible to do things like:

    >>> from osprofiler import web
    >>> web.X_TRACE_INFO
    'X-Trace-Info'
    >>> web.X_TRACE_HMAC
    'X-Trace-HMAC'

Change-Id: Ibd9de5dde77b5a0f8b37b23fefc4ed6167f6a00a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/96/273296/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #: Http header that will contain the needed traces data. X_TRACE_INFO = "X-Trace-Info" #: Http header that will contain the traces data hmac (that will be validated). X_TRACE_HMAC = "X-Trace-HMAC" X_TRACE_INFO: pack[0], X_TRACE_HMAC: pack[1] trace_info = utils.signed_unpack(request.headers.get(X_TRACE_INFO), request.headers.get(X_TRACE_HMAC),

commit_message:
Use NFV nomenclature for VNF and VNFD method names

As part of review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202823, it was
recommended to change the names of methods DeleteVNFLink to DeleteVNFD
& DeleteServicesLink to DeleteVNF.

Closes-Bug: #1475506

Change-Id: I7d054462d7ecbad852b94cbbefe9911b46b22355

commit_message:
remove keystone templated catalog

This is just another code path for little benefit in devstack which is
going to rot out. We should be opinionated here and only support the
dynamic catalog.

Change-Id: I4e5c7e86aefe72fc21c77d423033e9b169318fec

commit_message:
Remove empty tacker.pot

There's no need to have an outdated translation file checked in that
has no content besides metadata. For translations, the full file would
be needed which can easily be generated.

Adjust tox test so that it passes if no translations are in tree.

Change-Id: Ib1a7abf211ed8af515ae462fce845a028d577101

commit_message:
Separate log collection into its own script

Avoid having too much duplicated stuff by moving log
collection into its own script as suggested in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/264366/1/scripts/test-bifrost-venv.sh@80

Change-Id: I2e322fc1f12e270c9407e7320d0d0e8c5452c4af

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-26 21:13:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/02e01be982538fa293acec5deb201bf6f79bac01', 'message': 'Return HTTP 400 for invalid server-group uuid

Nova API properly checks that the value of the group scheduler hint
shall be a valid server-group uuid. However the InvalidInput exception
is not handled properly in the API and HTTP 500 is returned. This patch
handles the InvalidInput exception and returns HTTP 400.

Change-Id: I38d98c74f6cceed5b4becf9ed67f7189cba479fa
Closes-bug: #1535759
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-28 11:51:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/428a1361b1c33b1eb8d3fffb001e5fc1a150dc02', 'message': 'Return HTTP 400 for invalid server-group uuid

Nova API properly checks that the value of the group scheduler hint
shall be a valid server-group uuid. However the InvalidInput and the
InstanceGroupNotFound exceptions are not handled properly in the API
and HTTP 500 is returned. This patch handles the exceptions and
returns HTTP 400.

Also the scheduler hint json schema is updated to accept only uuid
for the group hint so that the actual error message more meaningful.

Change-Id: I38d98c74f6cceed5b4becf9ed67f7189cba479fa
Closes-bug: #1535759
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-28 20:36:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b806107ebc2f9e1a53d86a578196a7eaad3ddcf6', 'message': "Return HTTP 400 for invalid server-group uuid

Nova API checks that the value of the group scheduler hint
shall be a valid server-group uuid, however it was not done by custom
code not jsonschema. Moreover the exception was not handled by the API
so it caused that HTTP 500 is returned if the group hint wasn't a valid
uuid of an existing server group.

This patch move the checks to jsonschema and adds proper exception
handling.

Closes-bug: #1535759
Change-Id: I38d98c74f6cceed5b4becf9ed67f7189cba479fa
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-02 15:57:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/400699fe6bf2f7bc66f1bb7b00b32080c69f32c6', 'message': "Return HTTP 400 for invalid server-group uuid

Nova API checks that the value of the group scheduler hint
shall be a valid server-group uuid, however it was done by custom
code not jsonschema. Moreover the exception was not handled by the API
so both v2.0 and v.2.1 returned HTTP 500 if the group hint wasn't a valid
uuid of an existing server group.

The custom code to check for the validity of the group uuid is kept in
nova.compute.api as it is still needed in v2.0.

In v2.0 InvalidInput exception and InstanceGroupNotFound exception
are now translated to HTTPBadRequest.

In v2.1 the scheduler_hint jsonschema is now extended to check the format
of the group hint and the api is now translates the InstanceGroupNotFound
to HTTPBadRequest.

Closes-bug: #1535759

commit_message:
Return HTTP 400 for invalid server-group uuid

Nova API checks that the value of the group scheduler hint
shall be a valid server-group uuid, however it was done by custom
code not jsonschema. Moreover the exception was not handled by the API
so both v2.0 and v.2.1 returned HTTP 500 if the group hint wasn't a valid
uuid of an existing server group.

The custom code to check for the validity of the group uuid is kept in
nova.compute.api as it is still needed in v2.0.

In v2.0 InstanceGroupNotFound exception are now translated to HTTPBadRequest.

In v2.1 the scheduler_hint jsonschema is now extended to check the format
of the group hint and the api is now translates the InstanceGroupNotFound
to HTTPBadRequest.

Closes-bug: #1535759
Change-Id: I38d98c74f6cceed5b4becf9ed67f7189cba479fa

commit_message:
refactor generator closures to private methods

Move inline closures to enable unit testing of methods.
Refactored additional code to enable future improvements of generated
comments.

Change-Id: I03e96b0ed10d5fcd2b61ee9cfcde4c0a34f78a54

commit_message:
Install python-hardware package on the agent image by default

This package is required for advanced introspection.
Adds --agent-dib-extra-args flag defaulting to -p python-hardware.

Change-Id: I81f3a6bcad17092d5bb4b50ae02ce200354b4963
(cherry picked from commit a1e7ac04a3697b38120896a43565ea08fac2bbc8)

commit_message:
Remove bandit.yaml in favor of defaults

With latest bandit version, The bandit.yaml is only necessary
for advanced tweaking. We can just use the defaults.

Change-Id: Ic14f582b34f1477d81099777bcfa834811c6875a

added_lines: __author__ = 'stack'
deleted_lines: import json from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log import oslo_messaging from oslo_service import service as os_service from vitrage.common.constants import EdgeLabels from vitrage.common.constants import EdgeProperties as EProps from vitrage.common.constants import EntityCategory from vitrage.common.constants import VertexProperties as VProps from vitrage.graph import Direction LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class VitrageApiHandlerService(os_service.Service): def __init__(self, e_graph): super(VitrageApiHandlerService, self).__init__() self.entity_graph = e_graph def start(self): LOG.info("Start VitrageApiHandlerService") super(VitrageApiHandlerService, self).start() transport = oslo_messaging.get_transport(cfg.CONF) # TODO(Dany) add real server target = oslo_messaging.Target(topic='rpcapiv1', server='localhost') # TODO(Dany) add rabbit configuratipn # target = om.Target(topic='testme', server='192.168.56.102') # target = oslo_messaging.Target( # topic='testme', server='135.248.18.223') # cfg.CONF.set_override('rabbit_host', '135.248.18.223') # cfg.CONF.set_override('rabbit_port', 5672) # cfg.CONF.set_override('rabbit_userid', 'guest') # cfg.CONF.set_override('rabbit_password', 'cloud') # cfg.CONF.set_override('rabbit_login_method', 'AMQPLAIN') # cfg.CONF.set_override('rabbit_virtual_host', '/') cfg.CONF.set_override('rpc_backend', 'rabbit') endpoints = [EntityGraphApis(self.entity_graph), ] # TODO(Dany) use eventlet instead of threading server = oslo_messaging.get_rpc_server(transport, target, endpoints, executor='threading') server.start() LOG.info("Finish start VitrageApiHandlerService") def stop(self): LOG.info("Stop VitrageApiHandlerService") super(VitrageApiHandlerService, self).stop() LOG.info("Finish stop VitrageApiHandlerService") class EntityGraphApis(object): def __init__(self, entity_graph): self.entity_graph = entity_graph def get_alarms(self, ctx, arg): LOG.info("EntityGraphApis get_alarms arg:%s", str(arg)) vitrage_id = arg if not vitrage_id or vitrage_id == 'all': items_list = self.entity_graph.get_vertices( {VProps.CATEGORY: EntityCategory.ALARM}) else: items_list = self.entity_graph.neighbors( vitrage_id, vertex_attr_filter={VProps.CATEGORY: EntityCategory.ALARM}) # TODO(alexey) this should not be here, but in the transformer for alarm in items_list: related_resource = self.entity_graph.neighbors( v_id=alarm.vertex_id, edge_attr_filter={EProps.RELATIONSHIP_NAME: EdgeLabels.ON}, direction=Direction.OUT) alarm["resource_id"] = related_resource.vertex_id alarm["resource_name"] = related_resource[VProps.NAME] LOG.info("EntityGraphApis get_alarms result:%s", str(items_list)) return json.dumps({'alarms': [v.properties for v in items_list]}) def get_topology(self, ctx, graph_type, depth, query, root): return self.entity_graph.output_graph()

commit_message:
Log mutated options at INFO

We log config at startup, we should also log when config mutates. This
allows a person reading the logs to see what changed which will help
them contextualize future differences in behaviour.

If I'd known about Py3 sorting behaviour, I'd have returned 'DEFAULT'
not None from _diff_ns and this patch would be simpler; but I can't
change that now without a theoretical back-compat issue.

Change-Id: If0b9b39be8f9352d20b52d219c527e7faa79beaf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/85/273585/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fresh = self._diff_ns(old_mutate_ns, self._mutable_ns) for (secname, optname), (old, new) in fresh.items(): secname = secname or 'DEFAULT' LOG.info("Option %s.%s changed from: %s", secname, optname, old) LOG.info("Option %s.%s changed to : %s", secname, optname, new) return fresh LOG.warn("Ignoring change to immutable option %s.%s"
deleted_lines: return self._diff_ns(old_mutate_ns, self._mutable_ns) LOG.warn("Ignoring change to immutable option: (%s, %s)"

commit_message:
Index child plugins as part of parent

Runs indexing for child plugins as part of the parent;
errors if a child plugin is specified in the 'type' list to index sync.

When a parent is indexed, it will create mappings for any detected
child plugins, and index their data. Child plugins must implement
a property 'parent_plugin_type' whose value is the resource type of
the parent; the _parent mapping field is applied automatically.

This should assist with a restriction in elasticsearch 2.x whereby
parent mappings cannot exist prior to child mappings being created.
Ordering is such that the parent will come last. It is also necessary
in Elasticsearch 2.x to assign a _routing value when indexing child
documents; this is left to a separate patch.

Change-Id: I715b79a03491f102feee7d82fd1d49fb1cf29ae6
Closes-Bug: #1532972

commit_message:
Rename validate tox env to linters

This is the new blessed naming scheme for lint-type jobs such as
pep8 or the yaml validation job we have in this project.  Doing
this rename will allow us to use standard infra job templates
to run validation on proposed changes.

Change-Id: I0a4c4372429a08e0babb4d323f2b027f1d95f3d7
(cherry picked from commit e97fdbe639403032f8e4b667ca19086ec395377e)

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Script to add one new release to a deliverable file. # # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -e function usage { echo "Usage: new_release.sh series deliverable updatetype" echo echo "Example: new_release.sh mitaka oslo.rootwrap feature" echo "Example: new_release.sh independent reno bugfix" } if [ $# -lt 3 ]; then usage exit 2 fi if [[ -z "$VIRTUAL_ENV" ]]; then if [[ ! -d .tox/venv ]]; then tox -e venv --notest fi source ./.tox/venv/bin/activate fi new-release $@

commit_message:
Vertica cluster grow and shrink

Spec for enabling support for growing and shrinking Vertica
clusters in Trove.

Change-Id: Ieae1452db52a56e0d0cd7315d7fdbec380d3ed84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-specs refs/changes/39/263539/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode Sections of this template were taken directly from the Nova spec template at: https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/juno-template.rst .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None Note: This comment may be removed if desired, however the license notice above should remain. ======================================= Vertica Cluster Grow and Shrink Support ======================================= .. If section numbers are desired, unindent this .. sectnum:: .. If a TOC is desired, unindent this .. contents:: The Vertica database has elastic grow/shrink capabilities which are not currently supported by the Vertica guest agent for Trove. Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/vertica-grow-shrink-cluster Problem Description =================== The Vertica guest agent currently does not leverage the underlying elastic capabilities of Vertica. This will enable a user to grow a cluster in the event that they wish to accommodate more data or enable faster query performance, while scaling down helps avoid costs associated with overprovisioning. Proposed Change =============== As Vertica was architected from the ground up to be a clustered system, adding and removing nodes is relatively simple in comparison to other datastores. Configuration ------------- No configuration changes are anticipated. Database -------- None Public API ---------- The following public API calls will be made available to the Vertica datastore. * Cluster Grow - The existing call payload will not be changed. Implementing the grow cluster feature will add the new instances to the existing cluster. * Cluster Shrink - The existing call payload will not be changed. Implementing the shrink cluster feature will allow a user to remove instances from their existing cluster. Public API Security ------------------- None Python API ---------- None CLI (python-troveclient) ------------------------ Support for the following existing CLI calls. * cluster-grow * cluster-shrink No changes should be nessesary to accomplish these actions. Internal API ------------ None. Guest Agent ----------- To enable more efficient grow and shrink, local data segmentation will be enabled on Vertica [1]_. This creates additional local, logical segments of data on a node to enable easier shipping of data between nodes. The number of local segments is configurable with the scaling factor variable. Local segmentation has the drawback of making tables with many hundreds of projections less efficient [2]_. Grow ~~~~ Growing a cluster involves two main steps [3]_. First, a new "host" must be added to the cluster, which in the case of trove would mean a new instance. The update_vertica script is then called, similar to the install_vertica script, which handles installation of the vertica binaries. Second, the host must be added as a node to the database. The adminTools utility is called with the db_add_node command to register the host with the database. Shrink ~~~~~~ Removing a node from a Vertica cluster should normally only be done if there are enough nodes to maintain the K-safety level, i.e. 3 nodes for K = 1, or 5 for K = 2. If a user attempts to remove a node that would lower the k-safety level, an error will be thrown. Alternatively, we can allow the user to remove nodes and automatically lower the k-safety value. First the host must be removed from the database [4]_. Similarly as with grow, the adminTools utility will be called using the db_remove_node command. Then, the host to be removed is removed from the cluster, using the same update_vertica script but with the --remove-hosts option. Rebalancing and K-safety ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Vertica automatically rebalances data when nodes are added or removed. If nodes are removed too quickly, however, it may be possible that even though the k-safety level is met, all of the data has not been moved. Some experimentation will be required to determine if we can permit another node removal while a rebalance is currently in operation (the status of which can be checked in the ELASTIC_CLUSTER and REBALANCE_TABLE_STATUS system views). Alternatives ------------ It is not clear whether Trove should prevent a user from removing nodes that would result in a lower k-safety value. In some cases this could be useful, especially if the costs associated with overprovisioning the cluster outweigh the risk of data being unavailable. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- atomic77 Milestones ---------- Mitaka-3 Work Items ---------- - Grow cluster - Shrink cluster Upgrade Implications ==================== None. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Integration tests will be added or modified as needed in order to test grow/shrink with the new int-test framework. Documentation Impact ==================== The documentation should be updated to reflect the fact that grow and shrink is supported for Vertica clusters. References ========== .. [1] https://my.vertica.com/docs/7.1.x/HTML/index.htm#Authoring/AdministratorsGuide/ClusterManagement/ElasticCluster/LocalDataSegmentation.htm%3FTocPath%3DAdministrator%27s%2520Guide|Managing%2520the%2520Database|Managing%2520Nodes|Elastic%2520Cluster|Local%2520Data%2520Segmentation|_____ .. [2] The Vertica documentation recommends local data segmentation be done with numbers of nodes that are a power of two. Some experimentation will be required to see what is whether violating this recommendation is still worthwhile compared to not using local data segmentation at all .. [3] https://my.vertica.com/docs/7.1.x/HTML/index.htm#Authoring/AdministratorsGuide/ManageNodes/AddingNodes.htm%3FTocPath%3DAdministrator%27s%2520Guide|Managing%2520the%2520 Database|Managing%2520Nodes|Adding%2520Nodes|_____0 .. [4] https://my.vertica.com/docs/7.1.x/HTML/index.htm#Authoring/AdministratorsGuide/ManageNodes/RemovingNodes.htm%3FTocPath%3DAdministrator%27s%2520Guide|Managing%2520the%2520Database|Managing%2520Nodes|Removing%2520Nodes|_____0 Appendix ======== None

subject: Pre-load meta and sys_meta when constructing InstanceMetadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 20:52:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9f2aa4d89a69e4219d608dff6143dee7da13ff7c', 'message': 'Pre-load meta/sys_meta/sec_groups when constructing InstanceMetadata

The InstanceMetadata.__init__ method is getting the security group list
directly, and lazy-loading metadata (for launch_metadata) and
system_metadata (when getting the password).

We can make this more efficient by joining those tables in the initial
instance get query that happens in get_metadata_by_instance_id, which
means fewer round trips to conductor.

commit_message:
Pre-load meta and sys_meta when constructing InstanceMetadata

The InstanceMetadata.__init__ method is lazy-loading metadata
(for launch_metadata) and system_metadata (when getting the password).

We can make this more efficient by joining those tables in the initial
instance get query that happens in get_metadata_by_instance_id, which
means fewer round trips to conductor.

Closes-Bug: #1521675

Change-Id: I337d9ce3836b0a4629b5cc77d85f7578c894f360

Raise exception in find_multipath_device

When failed to execute "multipath -l" in find_multipath_device,
raise an exception instead of printing warning only.

Closes-Bug: #1519363

subject: Fix keystone wsgi configuration for ssl
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-22 18:24:28.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/e412427b02c6700fecfc6051e351491ef999353c', 'message': 'Fix keystone wsgi configuration for ssl

The default keystone wsgi configuration binds to 0.0.0.0, which
causes problems when we enable ssl on the undercloud because haproxy
listens on the same port on the public and admin vips.  Previously
keystone would bind to local_ip to avoid that, so this updates
the wsgi bind_host to return to that behavior.

Change-Id: Ie79dc3537204972c6e29e6db851afb901aa9da66
'}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone wsgi configuration for ssl

The default keystone wsgi configuration binds to 0.0.0.0, which
causes problems when we enable ssl on the undercloud because haproxy
listens on the same port on the public and admin vips.  Previously
keystone would bind to local_ip to avoid that, so this updates
the wsgi bind_host to return to that behavior.

Change-Id: Ie79dc3537204972c6e29e6db851afb901aa9da66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/60/271460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ssl => false, bind_host => hiera('controller_host'),

commit_message:
Add/remove port to/from existing ovs bond

Change-Id: I778968b6790bf572e5c3d9dc6916729a7482eaba
Closes-bug: #1490499
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/00/277400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if @property_flush.has_key? :slaves and @old_property_hash.has_key? :slaves slaves_to_add = @property_flush[:slaves] - @old_property_hash[:slaves] debug("slaves to add #{slaves_to_add}") unless slaves_to_add.empty? slaves_to_remove = @old_property_hash[:slaves] - @property_flush[:slaves] debug("slaves to remove #{slaves_to_remove}") unless slaves_to_remove.empty? slaves_to_add.each do |slave| self.class.addr_flush(slave) vsctl("--id=@#{slave}", 'create', 'Interface', "name=#{slave}", '--', 'add', 'Port', @resource[:bond], 'interfaces', "@#{slave}") end slaves_to_remove.each do |slave| vsctl("--id=@#{slave}", 'get', 'Interface', slave, '--', 'remove', 'Port', @resource[:bond], 'interfaces', "@#{slave}") end def slaves @property_hash[:slaves] || :absent end def slaves=(val) @property_flush[:slaves] = val end
deleted_lines: if @property_flush.has_key? :slaves warn("Do nothing, OVS don't allow change bond slaves for existing bond ('#{@resource[:bond]}').") # But we can implement this undocumented hack later # ovs-vsctl add-port br3 ee2 # ovs-vsctl list interface ee2 # get uuid for port # ovs-vsctl -- set port bond3 'interfaces=[0e6a0107-d0c7-49a6-93c7-41fe23e61c2c, 2c21e847-05ea-4b11-bde2-bb19e2d0ca56]' # ovs-vsctl show # ovs-vsctl del-port ee2 # ignore error # ovs-vsctl show

revisions:

where one of the forward slashes was missing.

Example:
/dev/disk/by-pathfake-ip-lun0

This patch revises the way the paths are queried so that the
forward slash is included.

Example:
/dev/disk/by-path/fake-ip-lun0

Closes-Bug: #1543238
Change-Id: I7eea70a32549c9d18820a5ce2155ecf93250158e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix output returned from get_all_available_volumes

The paths returned from the InitiatorConnector's
get_all_available_volumes function had a typo
where one of the forward slashes was missing.

Example:
/dev/disk/by-pathfake-ip-lun0

This patch revises the way the paths are queried so that the
forward slash is included.

Example:
/dev/disk/by-path/fake-ip-lun0

Closes-Bug: #1543238
Change-Id: I7eea70a32549c9d18820a5ce2155ecf93250158e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/76/276876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if os.path.isdir(path): path_items = [path, '/*'] file_filter = ''.join(path_items) return glob.glob(file_filter)
deleted_lines: file_list = [] if os.path.isdir(path): files = os.listdir(path) for entry in files: file_list.append(path + entry) return file_list

commit_message:
Remove multipath -l logic from ISCSI connector

This patch continues work on making the connect_volume methods
more efficient. Using multipath -l to find the available multipath
devices can take a lot of time listing all of the potential
devices. Previously, the FC connector had been modified to skip
the use of multipath -l.

This patch takes the FC code and makes it into a generic method to
be used in the ISCSI connector and the FC connector and updates tests.

I also fixed argument order in assertEquals() in the
test_connect_volume_with_multipath() function.

Closes-Bug: #1487169
Change-Id: If480df7c17a6f1c2ecebc0e00f5938d3056776fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/85/267085/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _discover_mpath_device(self, device_wwn, device_info, connection_properties, linuxscsi): path = linuxscsi.find_multipath_device_path(device_wwn) device_path = path if path is not None: LOG.debug("Multipath device path discovered %(device)s", {'device': path}) # for temporary backwards compatibility device_info['multipath_id'] = device_wwn else: mpath_info = linuxscsi.find_multipath_device( self.device_name) if mpath_info: device_path = mpath_info['device'] # for temporary backwards compatibility device_info['multipath_id'] = device_wwn else: # we didn't find a multipath device. # so we assume the kernel only sees 1 device device_path = self.host_device LOG.debug("Unable to find multipath device name for " "volume. Using path %(device)s for volume.", {'device': self.host_device}) if connection_properties.get('access_mode', '') != 'ro': try: # Sometimes the multipath devices will show up as read only # initially and need additional time/rescans to get to RW. linuxscsi.wait_for_rw(device_wwn, device_path) except exception.BlockDeviceReadOnly: LOG.warning(_LW('Block device %s is still read-only. ' 'Continuing anyway.'), device_path) return device_path self.device_name = None if self.use_multipath: host_device = _discover_mpath_device(device_wwn, self.device_name, device_info, connection_properties, self._linuxscsi) device_path = _discover_mpath_device(device_wwn, self.device_name, device_info, connection_properties, self._linuxscsi)
deleted_lines: if self.use_multipath: # We use the multipath device instead of the single path device self._rescan_multipath() multipath_device = self._get_multipath_device_name(host_device) if multipath_device is not None: host_device = multipath_device LOG.debug("Found multipath device name for " "volume. Using path %(device)s " "for volume.", {'device': host_device}) path = self._linuxscsi.find_multipath_device_path(device_wwn) if path is not None: LOG.debug("Multipath device path discovered %(device)s", {'device': path}) device_path = path # for temporary backwards compatibility device_info['multipath_id'] = device_wwn else: mpath_info = self._linuxscsi.find_multipath_device( self.device_name) if mpath_info: device_path = mpath_info['device'] # for temporary backwards compatibility device_info['multipath_id'] = device_wwn else: # we didn't find a multipath device. # so we assume the kernel only sees 1 device device_path = self.host_device LOG.debug("Unable to find multipath device name for " "volume. Using path %(device)s for volume.", {'device': self.host_device}) if connection_properties.get('access_mode', '') != 'ro': try: # Sometimes the multipath devices will show up as read only # initially and need additional time/rescans to get to RW. self._linuxscsi.wait_for_rw(device_wwn, device_path) except exception.BlockDeviceReadOnly: LOG.warning(_LW('Block device %s is still read-only. ' 'Continuing anyway.'), device_path)

commit_message:
Replace stubs.Set with stub_out (compute api)

As part of the ongoing effort to stop using mox, start replacing
the stubs.Set calls with stub_out.

Limit the scope of this patch to the 300+ simple compute API stubs.

Part of bp:remove-mox

Change-Id: I456deeb37c7a1af73d051b71f83658fcc1ac9396
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/268591/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.stub_out('nova.compute.api.API.get', self.stub_out('nova.compute.api.API.get', self.stub_out('nova.compute.api.API.get_all', get_all) self.stub_out('nova.compute.api.API.get', fake_compute_get)
deleted_lines: from nova import compute self.stubs.Set(compute.api.API, 'get', self.stubs.Set(compute.api.API, 'get', self.stubs.Set(compute.api.API, 'get_all', get_all) self.stubs.Set(compute.api.API, 'get', fake_compute_get)

commit_message:
Replace stubs.Set with stub_out (utils)

As part of the ongoing effort to stop using mox, start replacing
the stubs.Set calls with stub_out.

Limit the scope of this patch to the ~110 utils stubs.

Part of bp:remove-mox

Change-Id: Ia84cb5f07d6a410287a18b3146d8a0eda9f34da5

Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

Resolved with use of subprocess module

commit_message:
Change get_project permission

Previously to issue GET /project a user needed
at least project_admin level of permission. With
this change, a user can issue GET /project by just
having a role on the project.

Change-Id: I9d23edc22eb88d0b21ab8968dfbe63661220a6fd
Closes-Bug: 1535878

commit_message:
Use 2 network clients from tempest-lib

The files below have been migrated to tempest-lib

 * agents_client.py    : I97b67e2385452db6ef59bc4b8c63c211ca119bc2
 * extensions_client.py: I76b1d0b1c3ffb2c366c4e6d95105d9c8fde2a22b

Now Tempest-lib provides those as stable interfaces. So Tempest should
start using those from lib and remove its own copy.

Change-Id: Ia2b48d9f2848d006cd9734c7fb5c2ea65c13e043

subject: Last header not being copied in parser.py for GET
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 21:53:12.000000000', 'files': ['syntribos/clients/http/parser.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/syntribos/commit/0420f10d4cb9aea48dfebe5f228f3092fad47b13', 'message': 'Last header not being copied in parser.py for GET

In method create_request of class RequestCreator in file
syntribos/clients/http/parser.py line 43, the headers variable
is missing the last HTTP header when a GET file is being processed.
The code works for POST because the POST body is separated from the
header by two newlines. For GET requests, the index value is being
adjusted to account for the fact that it does not have a body so no
empty line will be present.  We just add 1 to the index in that case.

Change-Id: I91881e1882aab21c2c14a7ff351bb3f7b70727f2
Closes-Bug: #1543236
'}]
commit_message:
Last header not being copied in parser.py for GET

In method create_request of class RequestCreator in file
syntribos/clients/http/parser.py line 43, the headers variable
is missing the last HTTP header when a GET file is being processed.
The code works for POST because the POST body is separated from the
header by two newlines. For GET requests, the index value is being
adjusted to account for the fact that it does not have a body so no
empty line will be present.  We just add 1 to the index in that case.

Change-Id: I91881e1882aab21c2c14a7ff351bb3f7b70727f2
Closes-Bug: #1543236
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/syntribos refs/changes/82/277582/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if lines[index] != "": index = index + 1

commit_message:
Properly report preprocessing errors to a user

Currently we only return "Data pre-processing failed" and the only option
to figure out what went wrong is to dive into logs.

Also fixed error message for unexpected exceptions during pre-processing
to actually contain some exception information.

Change-Id: I998c0bbd48cc57b7b13fac220f4f7cfe2a5e0681
Closes-Bug: #1523907
(cherry picked from commit 22fddca500a1a8b1646a25fc372ba2cecf31e5b8)

deleted_lines: error='Unexpected exception during processing') error='Data pre-processing failed')

subject: RBD: flatten snapshot clones on demand
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-14 19:17:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e866041d93ca28133d73c596f4d2d67acca8e082', 'message': "RBD: flatten snapshot clones on demand

This patch also removes the 'rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot'
configuration option as it is no longer necessary.

With RBD's objectmap feature, it's no longer necessary to flatten clones
as a chain of arbitrary length has no impact on performance.

There is an added benefit of being less confusing to a user.  Even
though volume deletion is asynchronous from the client's perspective,
nearly all other drivers will carry out the operation successfully.
However for RBD, a snapshot with clones would raise VolumeIsBusy() even
though the client returns success on the command line or the API.
Confusion from both users and tempest tests make this change even more
compelling.

Change-Id: I42b7a3345623d733403e419052287b919db8ff30
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: flatten snapshot clones on demand

This patch also removes the 'rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot'
configuration option as it is no longer necessary.

With RBD's objectmap feature, it's no longer necessary to flatten clones
as a chain of arbitrary length has no impact on performance.

There is an added benefit of being less confusing to a user.  Even
though volume deletion is asynchronous from the client's perspective,
nearly all other drivers will carry out the operation successfully.
However for RBD, a snapshot with clones would raise VolumeIsBusy() even
though the client returns success on the command line or the API.
Confusion from both users and tempest tests make this change even more
compelling.

Change-Id: I42b7a3345623d733403e419052287b919db8ff30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/82/267782/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for (pool, image) in self._get_children_info(volume, snap_name): self._flatten(pool, image)
deleted_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot', default=False, help='Flatten volumes created from snapshots to remove ' 'dependency from volume to snapshot'), if self.configuration.rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot: self._flatten(self.configuration.rbd_pool, volume['name'])

commit_message:
Update yaml-validate.py to accept files or directories

For developer usage it's helpful to have the choice to provide either
an individual files, list of files, or some mix of files and directories
as you don't necessarily want to walk everything all the time.

Change-Id: I050de123bba51402a0dbb42d71e97fd27d7ce4bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/81/269281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Separate get_live_state on several methods

Currently each get_live_state implementation contains
two steps:

 1. get resource data and handle exception, which can be
    raised;

 2. parse resource data for following using it in updating
    resource properties.

First step is similar for many resources, so there will be
optimal to separate get_live_state on two different methods,
which can be override, if needed.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: I893f5eb418b4fa7659430b1a2c1f70df4fecb4f8

commit_message:
Improving python3 compatibility

 * python3 doesn't have types.ListType, using just 'list' instead
 * python3 doesn't have types.StringTypes, using six.string_types instead

Change-Id: I43125bb2ecd25cf958b299d26f4ac3a7828e9499

commit_message:
image build: add --builder-extra-args

Introduce a new --builder-extra-args parameter to allow pass arguments
to the image builder, to be appended at the end of its invocation.

Adjust the tests to account for the extra space (due to no
--builder-extra-args specified in tests).

Co-Authored-By: Jaume Devesa <devvesa@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I628228a406291fdc87a2990ab6e441ce01517ad0
(cherry picked from commit e4a4578ad25ffd59a0b905f79f5e95dbe9621e03)

commit_message:
Add expectation of fail for stop deployment.

Stop deployment on operational cluster should fail,
so add this expectiotion into test_scale_group_1.py

Related-Bug: #1543597

added_lines: import urllib2 from proboscis import assertsfrom fuelweb_test.settings import DEPLOYMENT_TIMEOUT def expected_fail_stop_deployment(self, cluster_id): try: self.fuel_web.client.stop_deployment(cluster_id) except urllib2.HTTPError, e: asserts.assert_equal( 400, e.code, 'Stop action is forbidden for the cluster ' 'on node additional step, so we expected to ' 'receive code 400 and got {0}. ' 'Details {1}'.format( e.code, 'https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1529691')) asserts.assert_true( 'Stop action is forbidden for the cluster.' in e.reason, 'Unexpected failure reason. Actual: {0}'.format(e.reason)) 4. Add 2 controller nodes 6. Check that stop deployment on new controllers is forbidden 7. Wait for ready deployment 8. Verify networks 9. Run OSTF task = self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait_progress( cluster_id=cluster_id, progress=60, return_task=True) self.expected_fail_stop_deployment(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.assert_task_success( task=task, timeout=DEPLOYMENT_TIMEOUT) self.show_step(9)
deleted_lines: 4. Add 2 compute nodes 6. Stop deployment on new controllers re-deploy 7. Delete 2 added controllers 8. Add 2 new controllers 9. Deploy changes 10. Run OSTF 11. Verify networks self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait_progress(cluster_id=cluster_id, progress=60) self.fuel_web.stop_deployment_wait(cluster_id) self.fuel_web.wait_nodes_get_online_state( self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[:3], timeout=10 * 60) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, nodes, False, True ) nodes = {'slave-04': ['controller'], 'slave-05': ['controller']} self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, nodes, True, False ) self.show_step(9) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(11) self.show_step(10)

commit_message:
Shadow users: unified identity - Shadow federated users

"Shadow users: unified identity" implementation:
Federated users have a idp_id, protocol_id, display name, and a unique ID asserted
by the identity provider. These are the minimal pieces of data required to identify
returning users and provide them with a consistent identity.

Note: Shadowing LDAP users will be completed in a different patch

bp shadow-users

Change-Id: Ic4319f3650955ee55c297d710f3b008a861d0e1e

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import sqlalchemy as sql def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = sql.MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine federated_table = sql.Table( 'identity', meta, sql.Column('id', sql.String(64), primary_key=True, nullable=False), sql.Column('identity_id', sql.String(64), sql.ForeignKey('identity.id', ondelete='CASCADE')), sql.Column('idp_id', sql.String(64), sql.ForeignKey('identity_provider.id', ondelete='CASCADE')), sql.Column('protocol_id', sql.String(64), nullable=False), sql.Column('unique_id', sql.String(255), nullable=False), sql.Column('display_name', sql.String(255), nullable=True)) federated_table.create(migrate_engine, checkfirst=True)

commit_message:
puppet: update mistral deployment

puppet-mistral was refactored to be compliant with other Puppet modules.
We did a lot of non-backward compatible changes.

This patch aims to update the undercloud manifests & hieradata.

Depends-On: I979e21caa71ee35337dc01b225878701868e966a
Change-Id: I5cbac7af7717e38870b1d47c0e174f54ca001be8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/04/277404/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Shadow users: unified identity - Separate user identities

"Shadow users: unified identity" implementation:
#1 "Separate user identities from their local-managed credentials."
Refactor user table into an identity table and a locally-managed
password table. Migrate data from the user table to these new tables.
Modify backend code to utilize the new tables.

Note: #2 "Shadow LDAP and federated users" will be completed in a
different patch

bp shadow-users

Change-Id: If7a465123a76a90c092863557cb6ae258025b97b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/45/262045/50 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import sqlalchemy as mysql import uuid def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = mysql.MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine con = migrate_engine.connect() con.execute("delete from password;") con.execute("delete from identity;") sql = "insert into identity (identity_id, extra, enabled)" sql += "select id, extra, enabled from user;" con.execute(sql) users = con.execute("select id, name, domain_id, password from user;") sql = "" for user in users: sql += "insert into password" sql += "(password_id," sql += "identity_id," sql += "user_name," sql += "namespace," sql += "password)" sql += "values" sql += "('" + uuid.uuid4().hex + "'," sql += "'" + user["id"] + "'," sql += "'" + user["name"] + "'," sql += "'" + user["domain_id"] + "'," sql += "'" + user["password"] + "');" + "\n" con.execute(sql) con.close() def downgrade(migrate_engine): pass

commit_message:
Added Keystone and RequestID headers to CORS middleware

CORS middleware's latent configuration feature, new in 3.0.0,
allows adding headers that apply to all valid origins.
This patch adds headers commonly used in openstack to cinder's paste
pipeline, so that operators do not have to be aware of additional
configuration magic to ensure that browsers can talk to the API.

For more information:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html#configuration-for-pastedeploy

Change-Id: I77980aad268fecd1d14cb57e6140f039c01d0eb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/09/265409/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: latent_allow_headers = X-Auth-Token, X-Identity-Status, X-Roles, X-Service-Catalog, X-User-Id, X-Tenant-Id, X-OpenStack-Request-ID latent_expose_headers = X-Auth-Token, X-Subject-Token, X-Service-Token, X-OpenStack-Request-ID

commit_message:
Add reno to glanceclient

Add possibility to generate release notes to glanceclient.
We need this because it helps to prepare good documentation
and provide useful info to Openstack users.

Change-Id: Ifce2df8ac5f3a14518a758d748964e7201a75291

commit_message:
Merge NodeAttributes model into Node model

* Move vms_conf from NodeAttributes to Node.
* Drop interfaces field, that is not used anymore.
* Fix all references to vms_conf across all sources.
* Remove explicit changed() call, since JSON fields
  can detect updates on all levels.
* Replace objects.Node.set_vms_conf() function
  with direct attribute assignment

Change-Id: I2112a6dba30b49e3d658ef1503ee48ad1f92e693
Implements: blueprint support-numa-cpu-pinning

added_lines: import datetime meta.tables['nodes'].insert(), [{ 'uuid': '26b508d0-0d76-4159-bce9-f67ec2765480', 'cluster_id': None, 'group_id': None, 'status': 'discover', 'meta': '{}', 'mac': 'aa:aa:aa:aa:aa:aa', 'timestamp': datetime.datetime.utcnow(), }] ) node_id = result.inserted_primary_key[0] db.execute( meta.tables['node_attributes'].insert(), [{ 'node_id': node_id, 'vms_conf': jsonutils.dumps([ {'cpu': 1, 'mem': 2}, {'cpu': 1, 'mem': 2}, ]) }] ) db.execute( class TestMergeNodeAttributes(base.BaseAlembicMigrationTest): def test_node_attributes_not_exists(self): self.assertNotIn('node_attributes', self.meta.tables) def test_data_moved_into_nodes_table(self): nodes_table = self.meta.tables['nodes'] records = list(db.execute( sa.select([nodes_table.c.vms_conf]))) for record in records: self.assertEqual( jsonutils.loads(record[0]), [ {'cpu': 1, 'mem': 2}, {'cpu': 1, 'mem': 2}, ] )

added_lines: LOG.debug('Found %s vertices to be deleted by consistency service' ': %s', len(stale_entities), vertices_to_delete) return filter( lambda vertex: vertex.properties[VProps.CATEGORY] == EntityCategory.RESOURCE and vertex.properties[VProps.TYPE] != EntityType.NODE, vertices)
deleted_lines: LOG.debug('Found %s vertices to be deleted by consistency service', len(stale_entities)) for item in vertices_to_delete: LOG.debug(item) for vertex in vertices: if vertex.properties[VProps.CATEGORY] == EntityCategory.RESOURCE \ and vertex.properties[VProps.TYPE] == EntityType.NODE: vertices.remove(vertex) return vertices

subject: Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-21 15:54:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/d2693cebc33200bef6c553b2da2c755bb249fdd4', 'message': 'Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

* Replace MySQL-python requirements with PyMySQL
* Replace "mysql://" with "mysql+pymysql://" in SQLAlchemy URLs,
  in code but also in doc
* Replace "mysql+mysqldb" engine name with "mysql+pymysql"

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

* Replace MySQL-python requirements with PyMySQL
* Replace "mysql://" with "mysql+pymysql://" in SQLAlchemy URLs,
  in code but also in doc
* Replace "mysql+mysqldb" engine name with "mysql+pymysql"
* 026_datastore_versions_unique_fix.py: catch and log InternalError

Co-Authored-By: Michael Bayer <mbayer@redhat.com>
Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3
Change-Id: I925f6ae442baaafd6e7c29fc1f5f80dc8b1733d0
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

* Replace MySQL-python requirements with PyMySQL
* Replace "mysql://" with "mysql+pymysql://" in SQLAlchemy URLs,
  in code but also in doc
* Replace "mysql+mysqldb" engine name with "mysql+pymysql"
* 026_datastore_versions_unique_fix.py: catch and log InternalError

Co-Authored-By: Michael Bayer <mbayer@redhat.com>
Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3
Change-Id: I925f6ae442baaafd6e7c29fc1f5f80dc8b1733d0

commit_message:
Validate type of loaded yaml configuration files

Processed yaml configuration files are expected to have iterable
key-value pairs so loaded_configs should be validated to make sure
they're dictionary objects.

Ansible Vault encrypted user_secrets will be loaded by yaml as a string
and then ignored from further processing.

Change-Id: I08c5bff89eae2d49ab595317f249a420196c9cb1
